unnormalised: Experts are emphasizing enhanced quality control measures across Indian manufacturing to boost global competitiveness and realize the vision of "Atmanirbhar Bharat." Dr. Meena Iyer of IIT Madras, speaking at a webinar on 22/07/2024, highlighted the crucial role of robust QC processes in minimizing defects and maximizing customer satisfaction.

unnormalised: From textiles in Tiruppur to automotive parts in Pune, companies are increasingly adopting Six Sigma methodologies and investing in advanced testing equipment. "A stitch in time saves nine," says Mr. Rajesh Sharma, a QC manager at a Noida-based electronics firm. Implementing stringent checks at every stage of the supply chain, from raw material sourcing to final dispatch at 14:30 hrs daily, is becoming standard practice.

unnormalised: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is also playing a vital role, conducting regular audits and offering certification programs. A recent BIS notification dated 01/01/2024 mandates stricter quality standards for imported steel, ensuring domestic players aren't disadvantaged. This focus on quality promises to elevate Indian products and boost exports. Continuous improvement and employee training at 10:00 hrs every Friday are also critical.
